title: Why bother to depict a stateswoman if you reduce her life to a bonk-fest?
text:
Helen Mirren's Catherine the Great neglects the politics in favour of the passion

When I was at university, we had on our fridge a set of rules for conduct handed out in someone’s Russian history class. They were Catherine the Great’s code for the behaviour of her guests. The list instructs them to get “merry” but not so drunk they stagger, to argue “without anger”, not to bore or be bored and, most importantly, to be discreet.

I sat down to watch the drama about Catherine now running on Sky partly in the hope of learning a bit more about her. The historian Orlando Figes had declared it to be a mostly accurate dramatisation. Helen Mirren is in the title role. Several of the scenes were filmed...
